intro: Verbascum majale var. lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceolate mullein, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial suitable for rock gardens or wildflower meadows. Its medicinal properties have been historically used for respiratory and skin ailments.
